result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Sameer Sodhi was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs shall be paid at the rate of $200/month commencing September 1, 2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.    There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

Forthwith, with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sameer Sodhi

records.addlTxt: Def in person & by Atty Julia C Westley.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Case has resolved w/both sides free to argue.  State puts recommendation on the record.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2; Court so orders.  Def acknowledges prior OWI convictions.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1.  Argument from State and counsel.  Statements from def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm set per call to counsel; notice sent

Atty Julia C Westley appearing for Def.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State w/ intern Michelle Alexander.  Video discovery reviewed, anticipates resolution and requests separate plea and sentencing date.
Authorization for Appearance
Hearing on June 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Atty Julia C Westley appearing for Def.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: CP.  Counsel req adj to obtain video from PD.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
16R 009025;   Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #111530 on 4/27/16
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Letter received from Atty Westley
Hearing on May 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Julia C Westley.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant missed court as had moved and thought both cases were being taken care and was misinformed as had served his time and went back to live with parents in Illinois and when received a call from WCSD then made arrangements to turn himself in.  State request $2,000.00 cash bond.  Counsel makes statements and request signature bond.  Court orders $2,000.00 cash bond.  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
